DataElement.preferredName: Patient Pre-study Chest Positron Emission Tomography Eligibility Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date a prestudy chest PET scan was performed due to a patient eligibility requirement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Pre-study Chest Positron Emission Tomography Eligibility
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a prestudy chest PET exam and patient eligibility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Pre-study Chest Positron Emission Tomography Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Pre-study; occurring before enrollment/treatment on-study.:The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
